verb.description: (of a person or animal) shake slightly and uncontrollably as a result of being cold, frightened, or excited.
examples: they shivered in the damp foggy cold
she gave a little shiver as the wind flicked at her bare arms
the way he looked at her sent shivers down her spine

origin: Middle English: from a Germanic base meaning to split; related to German Schiefer slate.
phrases: A house, is it? Well shiver me timbers. I always wondered what one looked like on the inside.
Well, shiver me timbers as he loves to say.
Well shiver me timbers and blow me down!
Truly this is worse than the Hey, you can shiver my timbers!
